headline: Can Musk sway Trump toward climate investing? Tom Steyer weighs in
summary: Tom Steyer, Co-Executive Chair of Galvanize Climate Solutions, joins Yahoo Finance's Madison Mills at Yahoo Finance Invest to share his thesis for investing in the energy transition. Steyer says he looks for companies that may not be featured on the front page of a newspaper like Tesla (TSLA). He seeks out names that generate "real compounding good returns" over a long period of time. "I think there's going to be a whole other part of this economy absolutely relevant to climate, where returns are going to be really good. Information, agriculture, sequestration," says Steyer. When it comes to public investment in climate technology, Steyer isn't sure if Tesla CEO Elon Musk can sway President-elect Donald Trump's position toward further investment in the space. Steyer explains how pulling back from a position as a global leader in the energy transition could be detrimental to the US's competition with China: "If we're not pushing on this from an economic and business standpoint, that means China is pushing on it from an economic and business standpoint." To see every interview from Yahoo Finance Invest, click here. Catch the full interview by clicking here. This post was written by Cheyenne Reid.

raw.headline: Can Musk sway Trump toward climate investing? Tom Steyer weighs in

He seeks out names that generate "real compounding good returns" over a long period of time. "I think there's going to be a whole other part of this economy absolutely relevant to climate, where returns are going to be really good. Information, agriculture, sequestration," says Steyer. When it comes to public investment in climate technology, Steyer isn't sure if Tesla CEO Elon Musk can sway President-elect Donald Trump's position toward further investment in the space. headline: Trump taps Musk, Ramaswamy to lead govt. efficiency initiative
summary: President-elect Donald Trump has tapped Tesla (TSLA) CEO Elon Musk and former Republican presidential candidate Vivek Ramaswamy to lead his proposed Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE), an initiative focused on curbing and reducing federal spending across agencies. Yahoo Finance legal reporter Alexis Keenan explains the specific powers and limitations this initiative will have compared to official government agencies To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

headline: Tesla recalls over 2,400 Cybertrucks in sixth callback this year
summary: A fault in the drive inverter in Cybertrucks manufactured between Nov. 6, 2023 and July 30 this year could cause the part to stop producing torque when the driver uses the accelerator pedal, resulting in a loss of propulsion and increasing the risk of a collision, Tesla said in a report.  Tesla will replace the recalled drive inverter with one equipped with a functioning component at no extra cost, it said.  After a two-year delay due to production and battery-supply challenges, Tesla began delivering its futuristic Cybertruck in 2023.

raw.headline: Tesla recalls over 2,400 Cybertrucks in sixth callback this year
raw.summary: A fault in the drive inverter in Cybertrucks manufactured between Nov. 6, 2023 and July 30 this year could cause the part to stop producing torque when the driver uses the accelerator pedal, resulting in a loss of propulsion and increasing the risk of a collision, Tesla said in a report.  Tesla will replace the recalled drive inverter with one equipped with a functioning component at no extra cost, it said.  After a two-year delay due to production and battery-supply challenges, Tesla began delivering its futuristic Cybertruck in 2023.
